fields.description:
A periodic email notification can be sent to admin about the user activities ( commit/pull etc)\\
on repository.

The frequency of Email notification can be daily/weekly/monthly.

The email can contain the summary of :

# number of commits per developer or contributor
# number of pull requests
# any other statistics

It would give admin insights on his/her repository.

Thanks
fields.summary: Daily/weekly Email notification to admin about summary of user/developer activity on repo

fields.description:
Hello

Filenames in Browse Source view (possibly others too) are slightly cut off in the bottom (see image)

FireFox, Windows 10

Grtz
fields.summary: minor issue with new design

fields.description:
A really nice feature would be to support auto-formatting of links in Markdown:\\
[https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet#links|https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet#links]:

*URLs and URLs in angle brackets will automatically get turned into links. http://www.example.com or http://www.example.com and sometimes example.com (but not on Github, for example).*
fields.summary: Feature request: Support auto-links in Markdown
Markdown styling - baseline of inline/backtick code text too high in new site's style
Test, foo

fields.description:
Some actions, for example, "clone repository" or "import repository" may take some time and sometimes this operation got broken. Which makes mandatory to the Bitbucket Cloud user request an support ticket.

Would be nice if, during one of this process, some action buttons become available to the user (Stop action, restart action, abort action, refresh ). With this, we would offer a better feedback about the operation that the user is executing.
fields.summary: Action buttons to some process

fields.description:
I frequently have a need to look back through my commits to find out what I was working on during a given date and time. A view showing all my activity, across all projects and repos, would be incredibly useful for this task.

This is effectively what "Recent activity" shows on the user profile page, only it would allow the user to view further back in time. A link to "view more" at the bottom of "Recent activity", for example, sounds like a reasonable approach.

Even just extending "Recent" to a couple weeks would make a tremendous difference.
fields.summary: Allow user to view history of their activity across all projects and repos

fields.description:
Configure BitBucket site to enable Mobile Web App capability.

It will be handled like an app on iOS and Android and can be used in Splitscreen mode.

https://developer.apple.com/library/content/documentation/AppleApplications/Reference/SafariWebContent/ConfiguringWebApplications/ConfiguringWebApplications.html

https://developer.chrome.com/multidevice/android/installtohomescreen
fields.summary: Allow Bitbucket to be installed as a mobile web application

fields.description:
When using list markdown (at least in comments on code),\\
the asterisks are interpreted as italic markers instead of a list.\\
This happens even when using the provided list-button.

Also the button should, in my opinion, always format the whole selected lines and not place the first asterisk in the middle of the line where the selection starts

!3575166708-Comment%20Markdown%20List.JPG|thumbnail!

!3666984956-Comment%20Markdown%20List%20Preview.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: List markdown does not work in code comments

fields.description:
The current version of BitBucket (with the new revamped UI) does not allow the over-sized navigation bar to be collapsed, unlike the older UI.

In the old UI, you could click on {{<<}} in the bottom right of the navigation menu to collapse the menu to only the icons of each item in the list.\\
!1324809347-sidebar1%5B1%5D.jpeg|thumbnail!\\
!2575757117-bitbucket-02-settings%5B1%5D.png|thumbnail!

In the new UI, there is no such way to do this, making it difficult to use the site with lower resolutions on desktop, or non-standard resolutions.

Adding this feature back in should be easy (seeing as it was in the site before), and would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Allow the wide navigation on the left to be collapsed to just icons

fields.description:
After login this dialog bellow is shown

!1066370756-Screen%20Shot%202017-10-12%20at%2009.22.16.png|thumbnail!

I find this unnecessary as the message well says all PRs are done and dusted... so why suggested I go see them?

Cheers
fields.summary: Showing button to open PRs when there's no need

fields.description:
With current webhooks payload, users can only distinguish a branch deleted with the following info:

* Field: "forced": false
* No commits array

It will be best to include "Branch Deleted" flag in the payload to easily identify what action had been triggered.
fields.summary: Include "Branch Deleted" flag in webhooks' payload

fields.description:
A short while ago the BitBucket API changed the clone URL it returns from {{git@bitbucket.org}} to {{<account/team>@bitbucket.org}}. This impacted our private Composer hosting (Satis-based) because of the following:

* The API returns the team name as the user for cloning (e.g. team@bitbucket.org/team/repository.git)
* Developers attached to the team do not have access to the team user clone URL (e.g. user called 'developer', who has read/write/admin access to the team called 'team', cannot clone any repository from team@bitbucket.org/team/repository.git)
* Composer projects would get developer@bitbucket.org/team/* URLs in the composer.lock file, developer2 would then get issues as they do not have access to the developer user.

In my opinion it should be possible for team members to clone from team repositories using their own SSH keys on the team user.
fields.summary: Changes to BitBucket API impacts Composer installation

fields.description: !795677349-Bitbucket%20issue.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Heading Design issue in chrome for Issue detailed page

fields.description:
# Go to any repository
# Hover mouse over repository icon on the top left
# Observe the hover text

The hover text currently falls behind the menu items.
fields.summary: Repository Icon Hover Text hides behind menu item

fields.description:
# In the previous interface you could see in the left column if there was any open issues on a repository. Now you only see a link to "Issues" and a checkmark symbol, even when there are open issues. This can make you believe that there are no open issues when there actual is huge problems in a module.
# Same with Pull Requests you cannot see by the left bar any more.
# Not using native fallback fonts before custom ones has loaded (there are ways to do this). So as a user you can't see any text before the custom font has downloaded, loaded and rendered.
fields.summary: Bitbucket.org Left navigation poor usability in the new interface

fields.description:
When the text is too long for the recent activities entry, the text is truncated and there is no way to get the full message besides reading the RSS or by looking at the HTML source.

Bitbucket can either provide a way to expand or display full message on mouse hover
fields.summary: Recent Activity text is truncated

fields.description:
To reproduce:\\
create a Static website hosted on Bitbucket Cloud,\\
check the Web site URL using Chrome\\
make changes to the Index file\\
Refresh the page in Chrome or copy paste the URL - new content will show up

Repeat the same steps in FireFox - the content doesn't refresh until you select "Reload Current page"\\
simply pasting the URL will keep loading content from cache that doesn't have updated content
fields.summary: When creating a static website on Bitbucket in FireFox updated content doesn't load

fields.description:
We're using scheduled pipelines to deploy servers and build images, but I noticed that we don't have a similar feature check compared to merge check. It will be great if we can have a pre-req check for successful builds before executing the pipeline schedule.

Sample Flow:

{code}
#!python


October 1, 2017
1. At 5:00 pm, Build new app in development branch (successful)
2. At 8:00 pm, deploy new app in dev environment (successful)

Oct 2, 2017
1. At 4:30 pm, Build new app in development branch (failed)
2. At 8:00 pm, deploy new app in dev environment (unexecuted due to last failed build in dev branch)
{code}
fields.summary: Bitbucket Scheduled Pipelines Check

fields.description: I would like to see the issue status shown in bitbucket inline when ever the issue number is mentioned. This helps me easily identify if the pull request has been raised premeturely or not based on the associated JIRA issues or in general its good to see the issue status. A similar view of the status could be provided the same as JIRA does in comment boxes when you mention thed issue number.
fields.summary: Visibility of JIRA issue status

Dear Sir/Madam,\\
since last week I noticed that new UI is not compatible with my preferred browser version - Mozilla Firefox 35.0.1, elements of UI are not loaded.\\
Re-checked with addons disabled, and updated both Java and Flash Player - still the same issue.

Google Chrome does not have this issue though.

Could you please check it from your side and maybe suggest the way to return to old-fashioned look? Browsing the settings and quick googling hasn't helped me here.

Looking forward for your reply,

Sincerely,\\
Pavel

fields.description:
Hello,

I am facing a problem, my one of the team member(Pooja) is generating a Pull Request from her cloud Bitbucket account. It is showing her name as Author but when we receive email, that email sends from other team member name(Nehal). Please refer attached screenshot.

Screenshot: Please refer my RED color marked with below points

# Pooja is the Author that is *correct*
# email notification should come from Pooja's account, why it is showing from Nehal's account?
# Why it refers as "Nehal updated Pull Request"? Pooja has generated Pull Request.

Please help me to resolve this problem.

Thanks in advance.\\
Bhavin Acharya.

I tried [file search|https://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/02/07/introducing-quick-file-search/]  feature in bitbucket ui and it seems useless in java project,\\

* src/main/java/cz/muni/fi/pa165/bottler/rest/resour....
* src/main/java/cz/muni/fi/pa165/bottler/rest/resour....

Whole path should be visible for this feature to be usable.
fields.summary: Make File search show whole path

This would allow quick navigation between the products.

fields.description: We rebase a lot. We don't want to see the committed date. It is annoying and unhelpful to look at Bitbucket and see different dates to what is outputted by {{git log}} and shown by Github (author dates by default). At least give us the option to toggle it.
fields.summary: Show author date instead of commit date

fields.description: Hi, I am trying to run pipeline on a utility in my account all this morning . but the piplelines agent is not moving ahead of starting agent state. Kindly assist
fields.summary: pipelines stuck on Master is starting agent

fields.description:
I thought I could customize the width of the grey navigation column when I saw the double arrow cursor (similar to the columns in a Mac Finder window, or changing the width of a browser window), but when I drag and release the menu snaps into two possible states; open or minified.

There are two different levels of interaction here; the finger cursor click and the double arrow dragging. But they both do the same thing - open or minify. From a user's perspective; if I can control the edge of a container by dragging it with with my mouse, I'd like it to remain at the width it is released at.

Possible solution: Perhaps remove the double arrow cursor and dragging functionality so that there is only one way a user can interact with the menu (by clicking). Keep it simple :)
fields.summary: Double-sided arrow cursor for adjusting navigation column width can be misleading

fields.description: When I click  in the Submit button, it not do nothing
fields.summary: Code Deploy not work
500 Internal Server Error using AWS CodeDeploy

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With environment variable set as below:

* V_NAME=my_test1
* my_test1_id=135

Pipelines display "0" instead of "135" with the following command:

{code}
#!python

+ echo ${V_NAME}_id
my_test1_id

+ echo $[${V_NAME}_id]
0
{code}

h3. Notes
Tried running with docker locally and below is the output:

{code}
#!python
root@56100f3cf9dd:/opt/atlassian/bitbucketci/agent/build# echo ${V_NAME}_id
my_test1_id
root@56100f3cf9dd:/opt/atlassian/bitbucketci/agent/build# echo $[${V_NAME}_id]
135

{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines: Incorrect environment variable's value displayed

fields.summary: AWS deployment not working

fields.description:
I have been seeing builds that take much longer than the sum of times reported in their various steps. I have been told by the BitBucket support that the missing time is the Docker image pull time.

Thus my suggestion is to show this image pull time explicitly.
fields.summary: Show image pull time explicitly

fields.description:
Hi,\\
today we noticed that in the overview page of every repository, the generated SSH URL is like:

*username*@bitbucket.org:organization/repository.git

But before it was like:

*git*@bitbucket.org:organization/repository.git

Why this change? When I use the SSH URL I expect to authenticate through public/private SSH key regardless the username.

If this someone else who has access to the repository uses my SSH URL it won't work!

Let me know.
fields.summary: Username in SSH repository URL

fields.description:
Sometimes we have pull requests into branches with active pull requests themselves. It's happened a few times where people have forgotten to merge these PR's into the branches before the main PR is merged (a common example of this would be a PR for a release branch, with sub-PR's being merged into it).

It would be nice to have a merge condition to prevent a merge when there are open PR's into the branch of a pull request.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Dependent PR's Merge Condition

fields.description:
Somebody add my public key to his account. And I can't use it in my account.

I try to do ssh -T git@bitbucket.org and see account, what I doesn't know.

As workaround I create temp-key for bitbucket only. But it is non comfortable to use one key for all and other for bitbucket.

I want to remove my public key from account.

For example with command:\\
ssh -T remove-my-key@bitbucket.org

Then owner of private will remove own key from any any account.
fields.summary: Remove ssh key from account by ssh
Visualising %20 instead of space in the path

fields.description: The deploy doesn't proceed after clicking the "Submit" button on the "Deploy to AWS" pop-up.
fields.summary: CodeDeploy plugin failed

fields.description:
Hi There,

I have laravel 5.3 project on bitbucket. I have all folders integrated with bitbucket except auto generated folders like Vendor folder. And I am trying to run Unit test with bitbucket-pipelines.yml. But  It is showing error\\
" PDOException: SQLSTATE[HY000] [2002] No such file or directory" on vendor files like\\
"/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/vendor/laravel/framework/src/Illuminate/Database/Connectors/Connector.php"  as i don't have vendor folder on bitbucket.

Is there any way to run PHPunit without vendor folder?

I have also tries "composer update" command befor PHPUnit in .yml file.

Thanks
fields.summary: Laravel PHPUnit with bitbucket-pipelines.yml file. Vendor related files not found issue

fields.description: Currently, Bitbucket has a javascript listener that always opens Pipelines links in the same window regardless of modifier keys used by the user. This causes cmd/ctrl+left click to open the tab within the same tab.
fields.summary: Build status links to Pipelines can't be Cmd-/Ctrl-clicked to open in a new tab

fields.description:
With https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/<user>/ssh-keys I can get all the ssh keys belonging to a user but only if I'm using a token generated from that user's account.

But I need to get the keys for all the users belonging to a team using the token generated from the team's account.

That team has no SSH keys assigned to it. Each user has it's own ssh key on their own account. If I try to get the user's key using the token from the team's account I get a HTTP 403 forbidden.

Is there a way to make this work?
fields.summary: Access to users' SSH Key via the API

fields.description: Clicking into every page (in our team Velocloud) takes significant amount of time for the page to completely load. Could it be that the cloud server is CPU overloaded ? This latency is effecting the productivity of our team.
fields.summary: all the web pages of our team "Velocloud" (https://bitbucket.org/velocloud) take a lot of time to load

fields.description:
Steps to replicate

Windows 10, 64 bit. Firefox 56.0

# Load the PR creation page
# Add $otheruser as a reviewer
# Refresh page

Expected behaviour

Either:

* $otheruser should be a reviewer on the PR
* $otheruser should not be a reviewer on the PR

Actual behaviour

* Reviewer box is empty
* $otheruser can no longer be found by searching in the reviewer box
* Creating the PR, doing no further action, results in $otheruser being added as a reviewer to the PR
fields.summary: Refreshing create pull request hides assigned reviewers

fields.description: We are using v4.11 of Bitbucket DC and tags with only with only integers are not getting deleted from UI.
fields.summary: tags with only integers is not getting deleted

fields.description: Hello dear Bitbucket team! I tried to change my Full name on bitbucket, it told me i need to use atlassian settings, I changed them. but pitbucket still says I am a Dmitry Postoyalko(This info is not right) I need to change my Full name to Dmitry Yudin
fields.summary: Personal info not changing

fields.description:
Add button or link to next and previous commits, if applicable, in the Commit view

This is specially useful for reviewing Pull requests and tracking latest changes by commit
fields.summary: Previous and Next buttons in Commit views

fields.description:
Previously when I cloned a repo I copy paste the command which was available inside the the repository page.

But now the ssh command is wrongly generated.

For example:\\
Previously it was coming git clone git@bitbucket.org:<Repo path>.git\\
Now coming: SumitPal@bitbucket.org:<Repo path>.git

The git clone git is replaced with my name SumitPal\\
!2632199351-Capture1.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Invalid command to clone a repository

fields.description:
names are stuck together in the pull request detail

!572347489-Screenshot%202017-10-09%2011.05.18.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: names are stuck together

fields.description:
We would like to see the ".adoc" documentation files as if they were the ".md" files of a Git project, so that when you enter the main page of the repository, it loads automatically.

A plugin already exists to do this. But it is not valid for the cloud version. Any solution to get it with the cloud?\\
https: //marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.christiangalsterer.bitbucket.server.bitbucket-asciidoc-plugin/server/overview \

Thank you very much!
fields.summary: view documentation files ".adoc"

fields.description:
I created a team.\\
I am a member of the "administrators" group for the team.\\
I created a private repository for this team.\\
I removed myself from the user permission, but still listed under administrators\\
when I want to add me again as a user, I get the message

{code}
That user isn’t part of your team
Are you sure you want to give repository access to a user who isn’t your teammate?
{code}

So it looks like I am not part of the team, but I am still a member of the administrators group.

Being a member of a group doesn't make me a member of the team?

The team is still listed under my account.\\
and I am still listed under the team members.

As a result, the DockerHub integration can't see my team until I add back my user name to the repository - though it doesn't provide any additional privilege, since I am already a member of the admin team.
fields.summary: Team membership not seen by repository

fields.description:
When a new user clicks accept invitation on their email. They will be redirected to create an Atlassian Account followed by creating a Bitbucket Cloud Account.

Once user is logged in to their new Bitbucket Account, user is not able to see / access the repository which they were invited to.

*Workaround*

Click "Accept my invitation" on the email for the second time after account creation to actually get access to the repository which user was invited into.
fields.summary: Invitation of a new user does not get access to repository after account creation

Text message on the first screenshot says: "We're stripping your repository in the background. You can download the bundle file created by the strip when the operation is completed."

fields.description:
We have a scheduled build that runs every hour from the master branch. Because it runs so often, it can make it super hard to, at a glance, see the health of master, "When was the last green build??".

It would be nice if we could filter those out somehow
fields.summary: It would be nice if we could filter out scheduled builds from the Pipelines UI

fields.description: When an account is deactivated in Bitbucket, the "contact support" message should include the email address for support.
fields.summary: Include a link to contact Support on log in page

fields.description:
Along with notifications to HipChat / Slack, etc "build lights" are a typical way for teams to see the live status of a build. This is also readily done by allowing desktop tray tools like CCTray and CCMenu to poll the status of builds and indicate when there is a failure.

Both build lights and desktop tray tools all support the original CI server (CruiseControl) and its XML-based status format.

As a CI server, it is critical that Bitbucket Pipelines encourage developers to be aware of the status of the builds before pushing, and should publish an XML resource for each pipeline / branch in the CC format. This is also a usability and accessibility issue.

Effectively, add Bitbucket Pipelines to the list at https://github.com/erikdoe/ccmenu/wiki/Supported-Servers
fields.summary: Publish Bitbucket Pipelines status in "CruiseControl" format for cctray, cemenu etc

fields.description:
When I sorted my Source code file names by name both on my PC and on my Bitbucket repository,  I discovered that Bitbucket uses an unconventional sort:\\
all files beginning with a capital letter are sorted first, then all files that begin with a lower case letter.\\
This unconventional sort nearly caused me to deprecate a couple of file that really need to be in my build.\\
Please modify this to sort in alphabetical order regardless of case.  Maybe this is useful in a UNIX-only world but it is causing me problems.
fields.summary: Name sort of source file names is not conventional

fields.description:
When attempting to side by side diff a file on the web, I ran into a strange problem where the line by line bubbles no longer show properly. Steps to reproduce:

# Have a file with 3,000 or so lines.
# Remove many lines from the original file, such that original line 1000 lines up with modified line 850.
# Scroll to modified line 900. It will be completely borked between the two until it reaches line 1000 in the modified file. Then they will match properly and be unborked.
# For bonus points, scroll back up and watch it re-bork.

Please unbork the diff tool on the web. Thanks!
fields.summary: Side by side diff fails between lines 1000 and 1000 for different files.

fields.description:
If you integrate Trello board with Bitbucket Cloud account first, then delete that Trello account without disabling the integration first and try to link that Repo Board to a new  Trello board,  the integration is not going to let you do that\\
The error you will get is "Something went wrong"\\
API error:\\
{"message": "child "user_uuid" fails because ["user_uuid" is not allowed to be empty]", "validation":\\
{"keys": ["user_uuid"], "source": "query"}\\
, "error": "Bad Request", "statusCode": 400}
fields.summary: Deleting Trello account and the board that is linked to Bitbucket will prevent further integrations

fields.description:
It would be very convenient to navigate through each comment made on seperate files in a PR.

For example : A PR contains 10 files with changes.

Comments were made on the 3rd, 6th, 7th and 9th file.

Right now the only way to go through each comment is to click the comment icon next to the file name and when you are at that comment, the only way to go to the next comment is to scroll all the way up to the file list and click on the next comment icon and you will have to do this for each NEXT/PREV comment.

A good feature would be to have a NEXT/PREV COMMENT button somewhere which would help a user navigate through comments. Just a scrolling the page to the NEXT/PREV comment would suffice and save a lot of time.
fields.summary: A way to navigate through comments in a PR

Search for {{awesome-app}} the repo is listed in results.\\
Search for {{awesome app}} the repo is not found.

fields.summary: 500 on merging PR

fields.description:
Users are able to merge an open PR even though the source branch has been closed.

Steps to Reproduce - We have 3 branches (master, develop, feature)

# Create a PR from the feature branch to the master branch.
# Navigate to Branches menu and click on feature branch.
# Click "Change Destination" and select develop branch
# Click Merge and select close source branch. Proceed with the merge

Now that the source branch is closed, navigate to the created pull request and you will be able to proceed with the merge. You will not be able to update the PR as the source branch no longer exist.

User should not be allowed to close the branch if there's an open PR.  Secondly, users should not be allowed to merge the PR as well as the source branch no longer exist.

It would be nice if there could be a notification to users that the source branch no longer exist when an attempt to merge on the open PR.
fields.summary: Users are able to merge an open PR even though the source branch has been closed

fields.description:

Currently there is no indication in the sidebar nor the repo's overview page about the public/private status of the repo.

It would be helpful to have this displayed somewhere other than the settings page. It helps avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Display the repository's public/private access level

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce issue:

# Navigate to repository settings
# Click on HipChat integration (under "BitBucket for HipChat" section)
# Click "Sign in to HipChat" and sign in
# Click "Grant Access..."
# Select a HipChat room and click Add
# Under "Notify room with activity in these areas:", check the Pull Request: Commented checkbox
# Click Done
# Make a comment on a Pull Request

Actual Results: No notification of comment appears in HipChat room

Expected Results: Notification of comment should appear in HipChat room

Note: Notifications for Creating and declining PRs are still working, if configured
fields.summary: Pull Request comment notifications not appearing in HipChat

fields.description: Please allow comments in side-by-side diff view of a pull request, so I don't have to keep going back and forth when I want to add comments.
fields.summary: Allow comments in side-by-side diff

fields.description:
Below is a snippet from our actual bitbucket wiki. The spacing between the first two list items is just right, but the nested listed bumps right up against the third list item:

* *Outside In* — When creating or refactoring a module, we refrain from thinking about its internal implementation. Instead, we focus on how other parts of the application will want to use the module, and thereby discover what the module's public interface should be.
* *Test First* — Once a module's public interface has been identified, we follow this process to develop the module:

*# Choose an unimplemented method from the module's public interface.
*# Write a unit test for the method. Initially, this will be a failing test.
*# Write just enough code in the method to make the unit test pass. The method's code is allowed to be ugly during this step.
*# Refactor the method until its code is concise, efficient, and free of side effects (i.e. the method should only do one thing).
*# Repeat steps 2-4 until the method is thoroughly tested (edge cases, unexpected/missing values, etc.).
*# Repeat steps 1-5 until the module's public interface is fully implemented.
* *Fast Feedback* — We value quick test results, so we use stubs to replace function calls that involve requests to the network, database, or cache. In addition, our tests can be executed individually or in small groups, and we strive to maintain a very short execution time: no more than a few seconds for all unit tests across the entire application.

I've attached two screenshots:

* One of the problem we're seeing, in case the issue is not reproduced in this bug tracker
* A screenshot of the error I get trying to preview what I wrote above
fields.summary: Nested lists do not preserve whitespace

fields.description: Hello, since yesterday we noticed that we are not receiving any Bitbucket notification when someone writes a comment in pull requests. This is causing us a lot of issues as we are not receiving notification when something needs to get our attention, making our development team to get delayed.

fields.description:
Hello,

On the bitbucket.org interface for a repository:

{code}
https://bitbucket.org/<account>/<repository>/
{code}

there was previously an easily accessible "fork" button on the left-hand-side menu to fork the repository you were looking at.  The "fork" functionality has now been moved under the "Create" button.  This is really not intuitive and it took me ages to find the new location.  I didn't even think of clicking "create" because I didn't want to "create" something new; I wanted to "fork" (copy) something that already existed.  Could the fork button please be put back directly on the left-hand-side menu rather than in a sub-menu?

Thanks,\\
Chris.
fields.summary: New interface has hidden the "Fork" button.

fields.description:
In our bitbucket organisation, we've create a team with a lots of members.

The users that have team administrator permissions can go to the project tab and see all team projects\\
The users that do not have that permission, get the error

"You don't belong to any teams. Want to organize your repos into projects? Join a team first!"\\
Eventough they are part of the team and visible in the members tab.

They can access project specific pages by going to the repository tab and clicking the project name there

Workaround:

# Grant the user Administrator access to the team account OR;
# Grant the user access to create repositories under the team account
fields.summary: Team members without "create repo" permission cannot view project list
